document.docAuthor: Fominykh, Dmitriy D., Zamotajlov, Alexandr S., Khomitskiy, Eugeniy E. & Titarenko, Andrey Yu.
document.docTitle: Carabus (Lipaster) stjernvalli subsp. gvalijai Retezar, Mravaldzali 1992
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of Carabus (Lipaster) stjernvalli Mannerheim, 1830 in the Caucasus, with description of two new subspecies (Coleoptera: Carabidae: Carabini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the knowledge of Carabus (Lipaster) stjernvalli Mannerheim, 1830 in the Caucasus, with description of two new subspecies (Coleoptera: Carabidae: Carabini)

.

Distribution and habitat. Lebarde was pointed originally as the type locality of this subspecies ( Retezár 1992 ). Later Retezár (2015) added a further locality, Plateau Askhi, located south-eastwards of Lebarde. We do not possess material from the type locality, though examination of the available specimens from Plateau Askhi revealed its identity with populations inhabiting various mountains in the Greater Caucasus (namely Racha, Lechkhumi, and Svaneti ranges) and morphologically corresponding to the original description. Thus the distribution range of
C. stjernvalli gvalijai
appeared to be actually much more widespread than accepted earlier. Nearly all populations were found on alpine meadows above 2000 m , only one was discovered in the forest zone.
